BOSS DESIGN INTRODUCES THE EDEN POD SYSTEM

Eden by Boss Design introduces a new standard in office design, drawing from positive architecture and spatial design principles used in urban planning. Featuring biophilic elements and modular flexibility, the Eden pod system adapts to a variety of spaces, from corporate enterprises to hospitality settings. With four modules ranging from an individual focus pod to a six-person meeting space, the system provides a thoughtful balance between privacy and collaboration, fostering work environments that prioritize both comfort and efficiency.

‘Eden gives designers the tools they need to realize the atmosphere and thus the workplace culture they envisage. Within a single cluster, you can provide focus working, formal meeting and videoconferencing spaces, alongside a lounge setting – each with outstanding levels of comfort, and each respecting different working styles and levels of privacy,’ says Mark Barrell, Design Director at Boss Design.


Boss Design introduces the modular office pod system, Eden | all images courtesy of Boss Design

EMBRACING BIOPHILIC DESIGN IN WORKSPACES

Eden, born from Boss Design’s 15 years of expertise in workplace pod systems, embraces the philosophy of positive architecture, an approach that places human well-being at the core of design. The company‘s human-centric framework promotes physical, mental, and emotional well-being by integrating biophilic elements like natural materials and lighting, alongside optimized air circulation and acoustics. The pods are designed to balance privacy and interaction, with each module crafted to create sensory-rich environments.

Natural light fills the space through Eden’s frameless glazing and glass-to-glass corners, enhancing a sense of openness while reducing the need for artificial lighting. The carefully selected color palette features frame options in Copper Brown, Reed Green, and Light Ivory. Timber acoustic panels and privacy screens add texture, subtly reinforcing a connection to the natural world. To further enhance the biophilic atmosphere, faux and dried organic foliage introduce the calming effects of greenery in workspaces, promoting focus and reducing stress.


from an individual focus pod to a six-person meeting space, the system balances privacy and collaboration

With its aluminum frame and glass elements being fully recyclable and timber components sourced from FSC-certified materials, the system meets today’s demand for eco-conscious design. The pods can be reconfigured, refurbished, or moved to new locations, extending their lifecycle and reducing the environmental footprint associated with traditional, permanent office structures. Additionally, Eden integrates recycled fabrics such as SEAQUAL, a textile made from ocean plastic waste, further aligning with Boss Design’s commitment to sustainability.


Eden embraces the philosophy of positive architecture, featuring biophilic design elements

EDEN’S MODULAR DESIGN ALLOWS CUSTOMIZATION & RECONFIGURATION

Boss Design recognizes that modern work environments demand adaptability, and Eden’s modular design responds accordingly, integrating fundamental spatial design principles to create flexible environments that adapt to varying needs within a workplace. At the heart of Eden’s spatial design is its block modular concept, which allows for individual customization and reconfiguration. Whether used as individual pods or grouped for team meetings, the pod system enables businesses to craft spaces that serve multiple functions within the same area. The flexibility extends further with video conferencing capabilities, enhanced by privacy options like reeded or frosted glass for confidential discussions.

The introduction of lounge furnishings, such as the Beau modular lounge system, transforms these pods into spaces that blend productivity with relaxation. Unlike traditional meeting rooms, Eden’s lounge settings create a softer, more welcoming environment where employees can socialize, collaborate, or simply take a break from their focused tasks. These settings are ideal for fostering workplace culture, building teams, and encouraging informal interactions that contribute to a stronger sense of community within the office.
